verbs.description: as [ARG1: the us economy] [V: grows] [C-ARG1: workers struggling to stay afloat] are demanding more the main reason for the revival of labor union militancy in the us is the strong economy with a strong us economy worker shortages and high profits for corporations are causing many workers to boost their demands federal mediation and conciliation service randi weingarten colorado boston twitter supreme court of the united states us washington state milwaukee redfored federal mediation and conciliation service united states national education association us congress robert bruno oklahoma north carolina metoo us supreme court manny monteiro arcelormittal usa university of illinois american federation of teachers nonunion us steel arizona richard trumka missouri director boston sheraton jahana hayes president america sheraton hotel united steelworkers time magazine kentucky bureau of labor statistics labor education program versailles west virginia marriott president trump
